intro: Hyoscyamus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered henbane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves with a heart-shaped base. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that are clustered in umbels, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open to release small, black, angular seeds. Hyoscyamus grandiflorus is known for its toxic properties, containing tropane alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals.
